# Edward Ludlow Mooney

Edward Ludlow Mooney (March 25, 1813 – July 10, 1887) was an American painter.
Biography
Edward Ludlow Mooney was born in New York City on March 25, 1813.
He was trained by Henry Inman and William Page, and was known for his portraits of famous politicians and officials.
He died in New York on July 10, 1887.
Selected works
File:AaronBurrSr.jpg|Portrait of Aaron Burr Sr., Princeton University Art Museum
File:Andrew H. Mickle by Edward Ludlow Mooney.jpg|Portrait of Andrew H. Mickle (1847), New York City Hall Portrait Collection
File:Armenian by Edward Ludlow Mooney.jpg|Armenian in Old Style of Turkish Costume (1848–49), National Academy of Design
File:Captain Oliver Hazard Perry, Portrait in oils by Edward L. Mooney.jpg|Portrait of Captain Oliver Hazard Perry (1839), U.S. Naval Academy Museum
File:The Reverend John Pierce.jpg|Portrait of John Davis Pierce (1846), Harvard Art Museums
